title: New COVID-19 antibody drug OK'd to protect most vulnerable
author: MATTHEW PERRONE; AP Health Writer
description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Federal health officials on Wednesday authorized a new COVID-19 antibody drug for people with serious health problems or allergies who can't get adequate protection from vaccination. Antibody drugs have been a standard treatment for treating COVID-19 infections for over a year. But the AstraZeneca antibody drug cleared by the Food and Drug Administration is different.
